Integrating stunt staff as a category worthy of award will undermine the performance of actors. It's like honoring the employees over their boss, or the gritty coaches and fitness trainers over the pretty athletes. The former are responsible for making the stars look great. Realize once stunt people are widely found to be the harder workers, the common actors' worth will be lessened. People will better understand quality work and demand more from the actors. It'll turn Hollywood's glamorous standards upside-down since it's the rough-and-tumble stunt guys behind the curtain making the magic.
